content:
Posted: December 18, 2015
												Although by no means perfect, Simcity 4 is probably the best (read: most detailed) city building game ever made. It simply has all of the things that would make any particular city builder great all in one place. A massive area for each city, tools for laying out your city that can be either very quick and easy to use or super detailed, numerous ways to tackle different problems, interesting rewards for progress,♥♥♥♥♥♥ this games graphs are great. The graphics and soundtrack show their age but are still great, and the absurd level of detail in every conceivable place is the icing on top. Almost everything about this game is a model example of fantastic game design. Still, if poor preformace is a deal breaker for you then you may want to take a pass; the game doesn't run terribly well on modern machines, especially with as large of cites as are possible.

Posted: May 25, 2014
												SimCity 4 is one of my favorite "city building/managment" games.  I originally had the "SimCity 4 Deluxe Edition" on 4 CD's but after fighing with EA to get the software installed and working. I just gave up and bought the game on Steam when there had it for like $7.00. I'm glad that I purchased the game on Steam!!! As long as I have my Steam account I will always play the game.Update 1/24/2015Now that I have been playing SimCity 4 Deluxe Edition thru Steam I love the game more so now. I also added the following in Steam for SC4's "Set Launch Options": -CustomResolution:enabled -r1600x1200x32 -d:DirectX -CPUPriority:high -CPUCount:1 -intro:off. SC4 been playing with no more crashes. If you want to use this setting make sure you change the following:-r1600x1200x32 -> to match your screen ressolution-d:DirectX -> SC4 was made for DirectX and NOT OpenGL.-CPUPriority:high -> use this setting if you have a Dual or Quad CPU (ADM or INTEL) (remember this game is from 2003)-CPUCount:1 -> use this setting if you have a Dual or Quad CPU (ADM or INTEL)(remember this game is from 2003)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 26, 2016
												I love this game. By far the best city-simulator of all time. Perfected and built upon its predecessors dating back to 1989, this 12 year-old game still holds up as the greatest. The mechanics are awesome, the graphics are hypo-realistic for a bird's-eye isometric perspective of a 3D city. This game puts SimCity (2013) to shame. If you are looking for the definitive city-simulator, this game is for you. Even the mini games are exciting, where you can do anything from piloting a crop duster to driving a tank with a working turret! Before you establish the city, you can play around with the landscape, making plateaus to valleys and rivers. You can also create disasters and unleash them on your city, such as volcanos, earthquakes, giant robots, and even UFOs! This version comes with the Rush Hour expansion pack, which comes with useful items like avenues and a vastly-improved library of transportation items like parking garages, subways, monorails, ground and elevated highways, and overpasses and exits to roads. Tip: closely monitor your RCI (Residential, Commercial, and Industrial demand) to suit to the needs of your sim citizens. Also, closely monitor your finances; you'll get kicked out if you go too far into debt, with a message stating "maybe you can take your chances running for senator!"

												This game is a lovely play, I clocked in a good amount of time and its a game you can easily find yourself addicted to. It ages well despite it's appearance and it's definitely something I would recommend if you're into City building type games.The only issue is, I've come across quite a catastrophic problem, I don't know if it's because my drivers recently updated or something else but one day the game just completely stopped opening up, the game would show up in the processes but then immediately vanish as if it were closed out. That was an extreme disappointment to me considering how much I played this game. I've looked into this issue and I can't find anything that could've caused this to suddenly happen. I won't say that this is an assured issue because very few people have ever had this problem, I feel like it may be an issue with carrying over to a more modern PC considering I run Windows 10 and the recommended OS is Windows XP. Trust me that it is definitely a good buy ESPECIALLY on sale, like seriously nab that♥♥♥♥♥♥ But be aware that you might run into some issues with such an old game on a modern PC just as a warning, besides that play away!

												Running low on funds to run your city?  You can do missions for the good guys or the bad guys and everything will be fine...or will it?   Go from building the city to playing one of the citizens real quick and back again.  But don't mess up too often or it could bankrupt the whole town.Has some bugs and is real old tech.  Still it is lots of fun.Simcity online should have been more like this game.Oh and another thing....the theme music for this game is Legendary.....boom boom boom boom, boom boom boom boom....etc....this music makes everyone instantly cooler just for listening.Oh and one more thing....you can actually connect your cities with actual roads and they benefit from the traffic and....well you gotta see it for yourself....the more cities you play the more your cities benefit.   Your new cities will start with any roads from adjacent cities that you've already created/played.  Try to find that in one of the newer city building games.  When you start a new one you can actually see your other city's connecting road when you start out.  Awesome feature.
